posts.content:
Posted on behalf of Robert B.

I recommend that you go to http://chocksaway.com/camper/index.html for better pics.

Thanks

Miles.

------

A 1967 VW RHD Walkthrough Devon/Dormobile Campervan for sale

I bought this Bus 23 years ago with the Paintwork as seen (except for the Grey and rusty primer bits), and it has been a labour of Luv ever since.

Before the Bus I had a 1964 and a 1966 Beetle which I sold on. I've now decided the time has come for me to give up on this restoration project as I'm not getting any younger.

So up for grabs is my 2nd Luv;

For those who want a 100% original Campervan that is now a 48yr old classic that still needs a little more TLC for it to survive for another 23 years.

Over the past years I have spent an immense amount of time effort and money resurrecting this bus to beyond its former glory and I have achieved this to a certain degree;

Sadly age and ill health have dictated against me completing this task.

Priced to sell at 14K. I am willing to haggle but please no day dreamers and no spare part scavengers, sensible offers only

I am also willing to negotiate the price if a decent motd 60s Beetle is part of the deal.

London Based South West area

Email address: rgbargee@btinternet.com

Tel:

-------

11 Window 4 berth Campervan

Lots of restoration done over the years.

Repaired or replaced many panels including:

Sill on Side panel
front and rear wheel arches
Rear corners/ Battery and Platform trays
Cab floor repair/ both front windscreen repair panels
Bottom section for Front panel inner and outer + posts
Both Cab door-windows repaired and all rubber seals etc have been replace, this however was done several years back and leaks are starting to appear.
Fitted Aluminium pop-out windows with all new seals.

Throughout most of the years with me the Bus has been parked outside in the elements, so the body/paint/panel-work is looking a bit distressed.

The Rear Cargo door Window seals have been replaced in the last 2 years;

This and the Side cargo doors are showing signs of rot/rust but are still structurally sound and in good working order.

The underneath is solid and well maintained (cover skid/plate removed but is included). (See photo pic)

------

Almost every window and body seals have been replaced with spares purchased from Alan H. Schofield who also supplied most of the Body Panels.

All the Seals and Panels that are not already fitted are included as spares and are as follows:

Roof vent
Dormobile roof seal
Side window seals
Engine-lid seal
Front door seal
Vent up seal
Rear axle boot kit
Roof window seal
Side cargo door seals (9 in Total).
Also 2x Cargo door bottom skins (panels).
MOTd in August 2014

Both King Pins were, replaced supplied by

A H. Schofield.

(MOT Advisory: underside welding is going to require further work due to poor quality)

Front Suspension and running gear has been repaired or replaced over the years.

Fitted HD Anti-Rollbar 3 years ago,

Refurbished Steering Box fitted several years ago (original included)

Upfront fitted 2 x original wheels and tyres

Rear 2 x ENKEI Dish 5/205 5.5â€x15â€ (fitted with lock nuts).

2 x Original Wheels with low profile tyres (Not fitted but included)

------

MOTOR

Original Air Cooled Engine with only 68,172 miles on the clock

12 volt 1500cc single port

The Distributor, alternator, fuel pump and Carburettor/Manifold have been upgraded. (originals available)

The main fuel line has been replaced with metal braided hose. Fitted a Bugpack single quiet pack Exhaust.

A very reliable and well maintained engine.

EMPI Hurst Style shifter fitted (original gear stick +included) Gear selector rods and parts overhauled in the last 18 months.

------

INTERIOR

Complete and original Devon caravette interior with Dormobile roof conversion, which is in reasonable condition, although both Roof vents are cracked and the mechanisms faulty all the roof seals have been replaced and they remain water tight.

Also included is the original awning with its accessories which appear a bit tatty but I've never had an occasion to open them out and use them.

All original Cushion covers and Curtains, some with water stain marks but all in fairly good condition.

The Cab Seats and all interior panels, Mats and Flooring have aged but are still in good nick.

The Headliner is almost flawless with only a 1 inch rip in it.

The Cooker and Cool box are not installed but are included (see photo pics).

The Steering Wheel was restored several years ago but now is showing signs of wear but is still solid.

------

Not so good Stuff:

Suspect rain water entering vehicle from front windscreen sill area.

The roof guttering channel area over the windscreen is rusty and needs attention

NS rear corner and wheel arch panels have dents and damage to the area that need repairing, the OS also has similar needs. (See photo pics)

The Wiper motor occasionally operates erratically and squeaks but does return to normal operation when switched on and of repeatedly;

It was repaired 4 to 5 years ago when the motor bushes were replaced.

The rear Cargo door and the Side cargo doors are showing signs of rot/rust but are still structurally sound and in good working order (See photo pics).

Recently I have noticed that the Rear of the vehicle is swaying especially on deceleration and braking.

------
What neck of the woods you in? might come have a look.

King of the chunks wrote:
What neck of the woods you in? might come have a look.


From the top of the advert:-

Posted on behalf of Robert B.

I recommend that you go to http://chocksaway.com/camper/index.html for better pics.

Thanks

Miles.

London Based South West area

Email address: rgbargee@btinternet.com

Tel: 07577 201771

Would someone please buy this !

I am having to keep stoping myself of thinking of selling my 90% completed project and buying this.

It's very distracting.

Jason

congrates on the sale

A RHD devon with doormobile roof - I can honestly this would have been the only van I wanted other than my Laura.

If this had come up a year later ( after I'd settled in my new pad, built my workshop and had a year driving Laura about ) I think I would have had this.

Someone has got a real find there, congratulations to you both.

Jason

jayvanman wrote:
congrates on the sale

A RHD devon with doormobile roof - I can honestly this would have been the only van I wanted other than my Laura.

If this had come up a year later ( after I'd settled in my new pad, built my workshop and had a year driving Laura about ) I think I would have had this.

Someone has got a real find there, congratulations to you both.

Jason


I have to agree. 67 Devon RHD, elevating roof AND walkthrough, plus lots of the og bits still there. Seen more barndoor sambas than these. The ultimate splitty camper in my opinion.

I have to agree. 67 Devon RHD, elevating roof AND walkthrough, plus lots of the og bits still there. Seen more barndoor sambas than these. The ultimate splitty camper in my opinion.



Stop, I feel even more gutted now

but hey what will be will be, and hopefully the new owner will now just what a rare beast they have and will treat it with respect.

J

Hello one and all
Above is my new camper, I'm so looking forward to getting into the camper club and asking you boys and girls loads of really dumb questions.

Haha, well done you. I was killing to get this. Had a 64 devon/dormobile walkthough resto project some years ago that never got finished. Soon as it came up I had two weekends away working & couldn't shift them & the guy wasn't up for me seeing it mid week! I was going over the Sunday on the weekend you must have brought it, finished work early on the saturday instead to shoot over but it had just sold! So you got it by a couple of hours on the day & my pain in the arse work schedule!

Good luck with it!

I to would have had this if my circumstances had been slightly different.

You've got yourself a rear treat there my friend. RHD Devon with Dormy roof.

lucky boy.

PS

Welcome to SSVC

J

Cheers guys, I couldn't believe I got it, I never even test drove it.
When I picked it up I'd never driven one before, I remember pulling away and approaching the roundabout and thinking s--t the brakes don't work didn't realise how poor old style brakes were, I thought I was going to run straight in the back of my missus. She'd have been pleased (thinks I'm having mid life crisis) driving home from London with them brakes and steering I was laughing my ******** off.

Great buy.
Make sure you get to the AGM at Vicky Farm first weekend in May.
Devon Dormobiles are the best in my completely biased opinion
Look forward to seeing this one get finished, a very cool bus, massive potential. Lots of pictures please.
